## 사건 정보

**사건명**: UNITED STATES ex rel. COY v. UNITED STATES
**판결일**: 1941-05-09
**법원**: District Court, W.D. Kentucky
**관할**: Kentucky, KY

**판사**: Miller

## 변호인

James E. Fahey, of Louisville, Ky., for petitioner., Eli H. Brown, III, U. S. Atty., and J. D. Inman, Asst. U. S. Atty., both of Louisville, Ky., for the United States.

## 인용

- 38 F. Supp. 610

## 판결문 요약


MILLER, District Judge.
This case is before me on motion of the petitioner Bernard Paul Coy to correct the sentence and judgment entered herein by the District Court on June 3, 1937.
The petitioner was indicted at the May, 1937, term of court at Owensboro, Kentucky, of the Western District of Kentucky for violating Sections 588b (a) and 588b (b), Title 12 U.S.C.A. dealing with robbery of a bank at New Haven, Kentucky, insured with the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation. These sections as they existed on June 3, 1937, the date of the petitioner’s conviction and sentence provided as follows:
“(a) Whoever, by force and violence, or by putting in fear, feloniously takes, or feloniously attempts to take, from the person or presence of another any property or money or any other thing of value belongs ing to, or in the care, custody, control, management, or possession of, any bank shall be fined not more than $5,000 or imprisoned not more than twenty years, or both.
“(b) Whoever, in committing, or in attempting to commit, any offense defined in subsection (a) of this section, assaults any person, or puts in jeopardy the life of any person by the use of a dangerous weapon or device, shall be fined not less than $1,000 nor more than $10,000 or imprisoned not less than five years nor more than twenty-five years, or both.”
